decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, ES6 and H8, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.9. | The proposed first floor windows in the side elevation of the two-storey side extension shall be obscure glazed and permanently maintained as such.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5 and H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.9. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES6 and H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9.
description: Two storey side extension, part two storey and single storey rear extension, front porch and installation of dormer window in rear roofslope of house (Revised application)
